data_table.description: TIA/Stroke, Exam 4. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: TIAE1
variable.description: [Medical history]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you been told by a physician that you had a stroke, slight stroke, transient ischemic attack or transient ischemic attack [TIA]? Q1 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE3
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had any sudden loss or changes in speech? Q3 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE4
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. During this time, how many episodes of loss or changes in speech have you had? Q4 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAE5
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. During this same time period, when did the earliest occur? Q5 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year ago
Greater than 1 year, but less than 2 years ago
Greater than 2 years, but less than 3 years ago

variable.name: TIAE6
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. How long did it (the longest episode) last? Q6 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours
At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAE7
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did the (worst) episode come on suddenly? Q7 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE7A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q7a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAE8A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Do any of the following describe your change in speech? Slurred speech like you were drunk. Q8a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE8B
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Do any of the following describe your change in speech? Could talk but the wrong words came out. Q8b [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE8C
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Do any of the following describe your change in speech? Knew what you wanted to say, but the words would not come out. Q8c [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q9a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9B
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did you have difficulty on. Q9b [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9C
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness. Q9c [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9D
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did you have difficulty on. Q9d [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9E
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Lightheadedness or dizzy spells. Q9e [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9F
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q9f [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9G
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. Q9g [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9H
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q9h [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9I
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Visual disturbances. Q9i [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE9J
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did you have. Q9j [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: Vision loss in right eye only
Vision loss in left eye only
Total loss of vision in both eyes
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the right

variable.name: TIAE10
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had any sudden loss of vision, complete or partial? Q10 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE11
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During this time, how many episodes of loss of vision have you had? Q11 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAE12
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During this same time period, when did the earliest occur? Q12 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year ago
Greater than 1 year, but less than 2 years ago
Greater than 2 years, but less than 3 years ago

variable.name: TIAE13
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. How long did it (the longest episode) last? Q13 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours
At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAE14
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did the (worst) episode come on suddenly? Q14 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE14A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q14a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAE15
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. During the (worst) episode, which of the following parts of your vision were affected? Q15 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE15A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did you have. Q15a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16A
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Speech disturbance. Q16a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16B
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q16b [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16C
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did you have difficulty on. Q16c [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16D
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness. Q16d [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16E
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. Did you have difficulty on. Q16e [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16F
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Lightheadedness or dizzy spells. Q16f [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16G
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q16g [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16H
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. Q16h [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE16I
variable.description: [Sudden loss of vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) loss of vision, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q16i [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE17
variable.description: [Double vision]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had a sudden spell of double vision? Q17 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE17A
variable.description: [Double vision]. If you closed one eye, did the double vision go away? Q17a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE18
variable.description: [Double vision]. During this time, how many episodes of double vision have you had? Q18 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAE19
variable.description: [Double vision]. During the same time period, when did the earliest occur? Q19 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year ago
Greater than 1 year, but less than 2 years ago
Greater than 2 years, but less than 3 years ago

variable.name: TIAE20
variable.description: [Double vision]. How long did it (the longest episode) last? Q20 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours

variable.name: TIAE21
variable.description: [Double vision]. Did the (worst) episode come on suddenly? Q21 [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE21A
variable.description: [Double vision]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q21a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAE22A
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Speech disturbances. Q22a [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE22B
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q22b [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE22C
variable.description: [Double vision]. Did you have difficulty on. Q22c [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE22D
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness. Q22d [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE22E
variable.description: [Double vision]. Did you have difficulty on. Q22e [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE22F
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Lightheadedness or dizzy spells. Q22f [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE22G
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q22g [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE22H
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. Q22h [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAE22I
variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q22i [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAEFLAG
variable.description: Indicator for presence of form [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: TIAECY
variable.description: Contact year [10] [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]

variable.name: GWAS_ID
variable.description: ARIC participant ID [TIA/Stroke Form, Cohort Visit 4]
